Articles.Content: Would it be possible to have a basic functionality GUI set up and included? I know it's supposed to be fairly simple, and I think the concept is awesome, but I look at any form of code for basically anything, and I can feel my mental gears grinding and breaking.

Would it be possible to have a basic functionality GUI set up and included? I know it's supposed to be fairly simple, and I think the concept is awesome, but I look at any form of code for basically anything, and I can feel my mental gears grinding and breaking.

Haha, glad I'm not alone in this!!

Config editing is about the heaviest code I'm capable of working with lol.

(that was not a self lol, feel free to have a chuckle at my sad lack of skills =P)
I'm wondering how hard it would be to make a graphical GUI creator, I might jsut try once I figure out how to make interfaces for this, seeing as I'm slightly buzzed.

I posted this awhile back:

It looks a bit tidier now, but just know that it's coming.
I remember hearing about some gravity mod, whatever happened to that?

I remember hearing about some gravity mod, whatever happened to that?

I have other priorities.

It doesn't function as I would like it to right now.

Currently the active vessel (for example a kerbal) is pulled to a vector that's at the position of the collider bounds of the gravity inducing vessel while in the sphere of gravity (Local SoI).

The vector follows under the active vessel "pushing" the rigidbodies to the gravitational area. I've changed the artificial gravity engine two or three times now. And probably will a few more times before I release it.

It's weeks away, not days.

If in the meantime someone else releases one, then I'll drop that project. I'm in no rush.
